alert.note: Alert for Clayton (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 27 at 12:50PM CST until February 28 at 6:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Iowa... Turkey River at Elkader affecting Clayton County. Turkey River at Garber affecting Clayton County. .Heavy rain has fallen on a primed snowpack leading to increasing melt. Flows in rivers will increase quickly and reach critical levels. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Turkey River at Garber. * WHEN...From this evening to Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Minor flooding begins in the communities of Garber, Osterdock, and Millville. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:15 PM CST Monday the stage was 13.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 18.0 feet Tuesday morning. It is then expected to fall below flood stage Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.2 feet on 04/21/1992. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. Next forecast issuance at 9pm CST.
